de.susebox.jtopas

Class CharArraySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.susebox.jtopas.CharArraySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharSequenceTokenizerSource, TokenizerSource, java.lang.CharSequence

    public class CharArraySource
extends java.lang.Object
implements CharSequenceTokenizerSource
    Implementation of the TokenizerSource and its extension CharSequenceTokenizerSource for character arrays. It is a shortcut for: 
       char[]           myData = { ... };
   TokenizerSource  source = new ReaderSource(new CharArrayReader(myData));
    The class also provides a faster access to the data in a character array through the methods of the CharSequence interface. Since this interface was only introduced with Java 1.4, this class can only be used with 1.4 or higher Java versions.
    Author:
    Heiko Blau
    See Also:
    TokenizerSource, CharSequenceTokenizerSource, StringSource

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int offset,
                int maxChars)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method copies the available data into the given buffer according to the given offset and maximum character count. See TokenizerSource.read(char[], int, int) for details.
        Specified by:
        read in interface TokenizerSource
        Parameters:
        cbuf - buffer to receive data
        offset - position from where the data should be inserted in cbuf
        maxChars - maximum number of characters to be read into cbuf
        Returns:
        actually read characters or -1 on an end-of-file condition
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - anything that could happen during read, most likely IOException

      • charAt

        public char charAt(int index)
        Implements CharSequence.charAt(int) for this class. Note that the given index is relative to the offset that was passed when this instance was constructed (CharArraySource(char[], int, int))
        Specified by:
        charAt in interface java.lang.CharSequence
        Parameters:
        index - which character to retrieve
        Returns:
        the character at the given index
